intro: Cardiospermum canescens var. glabescens, commonly known as the hairy heartleaf. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae, characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy pink or red flowers. The plant is native to tropical regions of the Americas and thrives in moist, shady environments. Its fruit is a distinctive capsule that splits open to release its seeds. The variety glabescens is distinguished by its reduced hairy covering compared to the typical form.
